text: Uh, so a new problem merges sometime around 2014.

Uh, for most of my time working for Obama, whenever we encountered some beltway political crisis that dominated cable news, we would ask focus groups of voters if they had ever heard anything about it.
Almost every single time they had no idea what we were talking about.
There werr things Washington got worked up about and things the American people cared about and rarely did these things overlap, but something changed.

Suddenly focus groups knew all about the trivial things and Washington would get worked up over and they knew about them in great detail, often reading back to a moderator what just sounded like Republican talking points or a Fox News story, which are actually the same thing."
